00027 #include <geometry/IRingAbstract.h>
00028 #include <geometry/ICurveSegmentAbstract.h>
00029 #include <common/Collection.h>
00030 /// \brief
00031 /// The GisIRing class is ring Geometry helper type.  This is the most general non-abstract ring type.  
00032 /// GisIRing is defined by an ordered collection of contiguous curve segments.
00033 class GisIRing : public GisIRingAbstract
00034 {
00035 public:
00036 
00037     /// \brief
00038     /// Gets the number of curve segments in this ring.  
00039     /// 
00040     /// \return
00041     /// Returns the number of curve segments
00042     /// 
00043     GISGEOM_API virtual GisInt32 GetCount() const = 0;
00044 
00045     /// \brief
00046     /// Gets the curve segment at the given zero-based index.
00047     /// 
00048     /// \param index 
00049     /// Input Zero-based index in the object's list of curve segments.
00050     /// 
00051     /// \return
00052     /// Returns the requested curve segment
00053     /// 
00054     GISGEOM_API virtual GisICurveSegmentAbstract* GetItem(
00055         GisInt32 index) const = 0;
00056 
00057     /// \brief
00058     /// Gets all the curve segments.
00059     /// 
00060     /// \return
00061     /// Returns a collection of all the curve segments
00062     /// 
00063     GISGEOM_API virtual GisCurveSegmentCollection * GetCurveSegments() const = 0;
00064 
00065 protected:
00066     
00067     /// \brief
00068     /// Constructs a default instance.
00069     /// 
00070     /// \return
00071     /// Returns nothing
00072     /// 
00073     GISGEOM_API GisIRing() {};
00074 
00075     /// \brief
00076     /// Default destructor.
00077     /// 
00078     /// \return
00079     /// Returns nothing
00080     /// 
00081     GISGEOM_API virtual ~GisIRing() {};
00082 };
00083 
00084 
00085 /// \brief
00086 ///  The GisRingCollection class is a collection of CurvePolygon objects.
00087 class GisRingCollection : public GisCollection<GisIRing, GisException>
00088 {
00089 public:
00090     /// \brief
00091     ///  Creates an instance of GisRingCollection with no contained elements.
00092     /// 
00093     /// \return
00094     /// Returns an empty collection
00095     /// 
00096     static GisRingCollection* Create()
00097     {
00098         GisRingCollection* value = new GisRingCollection();
00099         if (NULL == value)
00100             throw GisException::Create(GisException::NLSGetMessage(GIS_NLSID(GIS_1_BADALLOC)));
00101 
00102         return value;
00103     }
00104 
00105 protected:
00106     void Dispose()
00107     {
00108         delete this;
00109     }
00110 };
00111 #endif
